PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Agfa Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 12 ,1941 pg. 3, reads: "Roy Eldridge: Young Man With A Horn...A few years ago Roy Eldridge was just another musician around Pittsburgh, playing in local night spots and doing whatever he could to get along. Last week he came home with colors flying and hailed as one of the greatest trumpet players in world.  Now a member of Gene Krupa's famous orchestra, the only Negro member of the aggregation, Roy Eldridge is on top in the music world.  Pictures were taken backstage at the Stanley last week ... Bottom, left: Eldridge polishes his 'pet' and offers his winning smile. - Harris photos."
TitMainTitle: Trumpet player Roy "Little Jazz" Eldridge polishing trumpet in Stanley Theatre
